repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/33630.

`config.focusable` is generally nil, but the default is `true`. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31775 makes signatures will not be displayed or cycled unless `config.focusable = true` is explicitly set. @MariaSolOs, I'd like to understand what problem this PR is trying to solve, it seems that setting mappings for windows with `focusable = false` is harmless. 

Also added a fix (possibly a feature) to display the `activeSignature` on the first call.

comment_data.body: I still think we should check that `config.focusable ~= false` here. The cycle keymap is irrelevant if you can't focus the signature help window.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -381,7 +385,7 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
         return
       end
 
-      local sfx = can_cycle and string.format(' (%d/%d) (<C-s> to cycle)', idx, total) or ''
+      local sfx = total > 1 and string.format(' (%d/%d) (<C-s> to cycle)', idx, total) or ''

comment_data.body: I noticed this, but should we keep `(index/total)` and remove the key hints next to it?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -381,7 +385,7 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
         return
       end
 
-      local sfx = can_cycle and string.format(' (%d/%d) (<C-s> to cycle)', idx, total) or ''
+      local sfx = total > 1 and string.format(' (%d/%d) (<C-s> to cycle)', idx, total) or ''

@@ -381,7 +385,7 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
         return
       end
 
-      local sfx = can_cycle and string.format(' (%d/%d) (<C-s> to cycle)', idx, total) or ''
+      local sfx = total > 1 and string.format(' (%d/%d) (<C-s> to cycle)', idx, total) or ''

comment_regular_data.body: Hmmm, CI failed due to the revert message being too long. Should I try to reduce the length?

> Hmmm, CI failed due to the revert message being too long. Should I try to reduce the length?

Yes

> @MariaSolOs, I'd like to understand what problem this PR is trying to solve, it seems that setting mappings for windows with `focusable = false` is harmless.

It was a UI fix. There's no point in having a message in the window title for a keymap that isn't available.

> Yes

Revert PRs generally include the complete commit information of the original revert PR. Should I delete the excessively long parts?

> Revert PRs generally include the complete commit information of the original revert PR. Should I delete the excessively long parts?

Yeah. This PR isn't really reverting https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31775 anyway so it's better to use something more descriptive of all the changes you're making.
Thanks. I kept `can_cycle` while resolving the bug, so that commit is no longer a revert commit.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(lsp): cycling signatures with the default `config.focusable`
